column4: anyone here who uses successfully ubuntu 32 bit with 4 GB RAM and the nvidia prop. driver? I am trying to use the server kernel (for the 4GB) but xorg will not start until I switch back to generic kernel.
I think you'll find it easier to go with 64bit
no I tried it but I had too much troubles with my IDEs
x64 isn't as stable as they promise
ok.. I guess I'll have to give my box a kick then.. it isn't living up to the expectations
haven't got it?
huh?
ah.. I'm already running 64bit ubuntu..
but apparently I'm not getting the full experience.. mine is just boring stable =)
are you running with compiz?
yup
with proprietary driver?
yup
with extra visual effects?
well.. I'm not to much into writing with fire and spinning cubes.. I've customized my effects.. I use the expose stuff and some window animations and that's about it
but I have tried out the effects.. I just think they get in the way of actually.. doing stuff =)
okay I had also the effects activated und 8.10 and 9.04. The support under itrepid is much better under x64 but not as stable as with 32bit
what graphics card are you using?
nvidia
I have a nvidia 8800gtx.. not sure if it makes a difference though
Quadro NVS 140M on my side. A mobile nvidia
anyway i had much problems with my IDEs and also with the graphics, but the most pain came from my IDEs (Java)
well.. let's hope they improve whatever it is that is causing the mess
